summary: This bill, the United States-Israel Bilateral Innovation for Research and Development in Health Act of 2025, aims to establish a joint program between the U.S. and Israel to foster collaboration in health-related areas. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to create the BIRD Health Program, administered by the BIRD Foundation, to facilitate research, commercialization, and deployment of healthcare products and services. The program will focus on areas like medical devices, pharmaceuticals, telemedicine, and disease prevention, with funding authorized at $10 million annually from 2026-2032. The program also involves reporting to Congress and reviews of its success.
